channel.title: Projects on Ingrid Arreola | Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Ingrid Arreola | Portfolio

item.title: 2019 Indiana KIDS COUNT® Data Book
item.description: Overview The 2019 Indiana KIDS COUNT® Data Book is the leading data resource on Hoosier youth. This is produced annually and is designed to be a go-to source for the latest research and information.

item.title: 2020 Flipping Finance Challenge
item.description: Overview “The Indiana Bond Bank’s Flipping Finance Challenge is a public-finance focused innovation summit. The 2020 Flipping Finance Challenge convened Hoosiers with diverse skills and subject matter expertise in one collaborative environment to create solutions to complex local challenges.

item.title: Data For A Cause
item.description: Overview “For the third consecutive year, data visualisation producers from around the world took on the Global Peace Index in the #dataforacause challenge. Over one thousand data professionals competed in this year’s challenge that tasked participants with analysing the diverging or converging trends of the global peace gap from 2008 to 2019.

item.title: Indiana COVID-19 Resource Dashboard
item.description: Overview During the beginning of the pandemic it became increasingly apparent that its effects would continue to grow throughout the year. While various organizations scrambled to collaborate, the onus fell on my partner, Aubrey Xiong, and myself to compile resources to aid families that have been ailing.

item.title: Iron Quest
item.description: Overview “Iron Quest is a monthly community-led data visualization project which follows a similar format to the Tableau Iron Viz feeder competitions. Participants have a calendar month to source a suitable data set and then design, build and submit a data visualization.

item.title: Mom and Baby Datapalooza
item.description: Challenge Indiana HIMSS in coordination with FSSA, ISDH, MPH, Regenstrief Institute, and KSM Consulting conducted a data visualization and analytics challenge. This competition focused on visualizing infant mortality in Indiana to ultimately improve health outcomes for Indiana’s mothers and infants.
